newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sony entry in JskyB would ensure success -- Softbank.
newsitem.headline: Sony entry in JskyB would ensure success -- Softbank.

text.p: Softbank Corp said on Friday that Sony Corp's possible participation in Japan Sky Broadcasting Co, or JSkyB, would ensure the success of the Japanese satellite broadcasting venture.
Softbank is already a partner in the JSkyB venture along with News Corp.
Sony has a wide variety of high-quality software and its broadcasting equipment technology enjoys a high reputation worldwide, Softbank said in a statement.

"We believe that its participation would ensure the success of JSkyB," it said. "We believe Sony's entry into JSkyB in a responsible manner would ensure the safety and success of the project and boost its value."
Referring to a Japanese newspaper report that Sony plans to take a one-third stake in JSkyB, the company said nothing had yet been decided.

"We have been in talks over Sony's possible participation in JSkyB and the negotiations are still going on. We haven't reached any basic agreement yet. But News Corp, Sony and our company are all positively considering Sony's possible participation," the company said.
